legalnotice.title: Feedback
legalnotice.para: To report a bug or make a suggestion regarding the Evince Document Viewer application or this manual, follow the directions in the MATE Feedback Page.

sect1.title: Introduccion
sect1.para: The Evince Document Viewer application enables you to view documents of various formats like Portable Document Format (PDF) files and PostScript files. Evince Document Viewer follows Freedesktop.org and MATE standards to provide integration with Desktop Environment.

sect2.title: To Start Evince Document Viewer
sect2.para: Evince Document Viewer starts when you open a document such as a PDF or PostScript file.
Alternatively, you can start Evince Document Viewer from the command line, with the command: evince.

sect2.title: When You Start Evince Document Viewer
sect2.para: When you start Evince Document Viewer, the following window is displayed.

textobject.phrase: Shows Evince Document Viewer main window. Contains titlebar, menubar, toolbar and display area. Menubar contains File, Edit, View, Go and Help menus.

sect2.para: The Evince Document Viewer window contains the following elements:

listitem.para: The menus on the menubar contain all of the commands that you need to work with documents in Evince Document Viewer.
The toolbar contains a subset of the commands that you can access from the menubar.
The display area displays the document.

sect2.para:

This manual documents functionality from the menubar.

sect2.title: Dobrir un document
sect2.para: To open a document, perform the following steps:

listitem.para: Choose FileOpen .
In the Open Document dialog, select the file you want to open.
Click Open. Evince Document Viewer displays the name of the document in the titlebar of the window.

sect2.para: To open another document, choose FileOpen again. Evince Document Viewer opens each file in a new window.
If you try to open a document with format that Evince Document Viewer does not recognize, the application displays an error message.

sect2.title: To Navigate Through a Document
sect2.para: You can navigate through a file as follows:

listitem.para: To view the next page, choose Go Next Page .
To view the previous page, choose Go Previous Page .
To view the first page in the document, choose Go First Page .
To view the last page in the document, choose Go Last Page .
To view a particular page, enter the page number or page label in the text box on the toolbar, then press Return.

sect2.title: To Scroll a Page
sect2.para: To display the page contents that are not currently displayed in the display area, use the following methods:

listitem.para: Use the arrow keys or space key on the keyboard.
Drag the display area by clicking with the middle mouse button somewhere in the document and then moving the mouse. For example, to scroll down the page, drag the display area upwards in the window.
Use the scrollbars on the window.

sect2.title: To Change the Page Size
sect2.para: You can use the following methods to resize a page in the Evince Document Viewer display area:

listitem.para: To increase the page size, choose View Zoom In .
To decrease the page size, choose View Zoom Out .
To resize a page to have the same width as the Evince Document Viewer display area, choose View Fit page width .
To resize a page to fit within the Evince Document Viewer display area, choose View Best Fit .

To resize the Evince Document Viewer window to have the same width and height as the screen, choose View Full Screen . To resize the Evince Document Viewer window to the original size, click on the Exit Full Screen button.

sect2.title: To View Pages or Document Structure
sect2.para: To view bookmarks or pages, perform the following steps:

listitem.para: Choose View Sidebar or press F9.
Use the drop-down list in the side-pane header to select whether to display document structure or pages in the side pane.
Use the side-pane scrollbars to display the required item or page in the side pane.
Click on an entry to navigate to that location in the document. Click on a page to navigate to that page in the document.

sect2.title: To View the Properties of a Document
sect2.para:
To view the properties of a document, choose
File Properties .
The Properties dialog displays all information available

sect2.title: Estampar un document
sect2.para: To print a Document, choose File Print .

note.para: If you cannot choose the Print menu item, the author of the document has disabled the print option for this document. To enable the print option, you must enter the master password when you open the document. See for more information about password-protected files.

sect2.title: To Copy a Document
sect2.para: To copy a file, perform the following steps:

listitem.para: Choose File Save a Copy .
Type the new filename in the Filename text box in the Save a Copy dialog.
If necessary, specify the location of the copied document. By default, copies are saved in your home directory.
Click Save.

sect2.title: To Work With Password-Protected Documents
sect2.para: An author can use the following password levels to protect a document:

listitem.para: User password that allows others only to read the document.
Master password that allows others to perform additional actions, such as print the document.

sect2.para: When you try to open a password-protected document, Evince Document Viewer displays a security dialog. Type either the user password or the master password in the Enter document password text box, then click Open Document.

sect2.title: Tampar un document
sect2.para: To close a document, choose File Close .
If the window is the last Evince Document Viewer window open, the application exits.
